record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name="dbdict" and term="Valid field types" and format.name="dbutil.type.list" and syslanguage="en"
record.recordid: dbdict - Valid field types - dbutil.type.list - en
record.file.name: dbdict
record.format.name: dbutil.type.list

brief.brief: When you select a Field Type and press Enter, Service Manager displays the new field type in the Edit Field Window.

detail.detail: (1) Number: Allows only numeric input in the field.
(2) Character: Allows input of any available characters.
(3) Date/Time: Requires field to contain the following formatted data:
mm/dd/yy hh:mm:ss or mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss for years
(4) Logical: Contains one of the following logical values: true, false, NULL or unknown.
Note: Service Manager accepts input of yes or no.
(5) Label: Used only in RAD applications.
(6) Record: Used only in RAD applications.
(8) Array: A compound data element that contains one or more elements of a single data type.
(9) Structure: A compound data element that contains several sub-fields, each of which may have a different data type.
(11) Expression: Used only in RAD applications.
